meanings.definition: Become subject to (something unwelcome or unpleasant) as a result of one's own behavior or actions.
meanings.sent1: She will incur a fine for parking in the wrong spot.
meanings.sent2: If you don't pay attention, you may incur a penalty.
meanings.sent3: Tom didn't want to incur the wrath of his teacher by being late.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs, he unknowingly incurred a great loss.
meanings.sent5: The careless hiker incurred the anger of the forest ranger by leaving trash behind.

meanings.definition: Bring upon oneself (something unwelcome or unpleasant) as a result of one's own behavior or actions.
meanings.sent1: His reckless behavior will incur consequences sooner or later.
meanings.sent2: If you lie, you will incur distrust from others.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her love for ice cream might incur an addiction.
meanings.sent4: By skipping class, he unknowingly incurred the disappointment of his parents.
meanings.sent5: The irresponsible actions of the driver incurred a serious accident.
